title: What about autism?
cleaned_text: What about autism? Key facts - A number of high-quality studies have confirmed that vaccination does not cause autism. - Elements of the research paper that raised the possibility of a connection between vaccination and autism (published in 1998) were found to be false. The medical journal in which the research was published has printed an apology. - Current research suggests that autism is probably due to a combination of developmental, genetic and environmental factors.
